sentences: Mul on veel üks tükki kooke.
context: The Estonian word 'tükki' is part of the partitive case form, specifically the illative case (directional) of the root word 'tükk'. It means 'a piece of' or 'into a piece'. This grammatical structure indicates taking or receiving a portion of something. In examples like 'Tükki leiba palun' ('A piece of bread please'), it shows someone requesting a portion of bread. The word can refer to various types of portions depending on context - slices, bits, chunks, etc.
